An Array is a fundamental data structure that stores elements in contiguous memory locations. Elements are accessed using an index, starting from 0. Arrays provide constant-time access to elements but have fixed size in most languages. They're ideal for scenarios where you need fast random access to elements and know the approximate size in advance.
